source: MCP Bootstrap + IRCC Website + Federal Court Jurisprudence

CREDIBILITY_CONCERN.description: Testimony inconsistencies that undermine claim credibility
indicators: Timeline discrepancies between documents and testimony
Failure to mention significant events in BOC
Vague or evasive answers to direct questions
Embellishment of persecution claims over time
mitigation_strategies: Prepare consistent, detailed narrative
Gather corroborating documentary evidence
Address any discrepancies proactively with explanations
Obtain witness statements where possible

INSUFFICIENT_PERSECUTION.description: Claimed harm does not meet persecution threshold
indicators: General country conditions without personal nexus
Harm not linked to Convention ground
mitigation_strategies: Document severity and frequency of harm
Show cumulative effect of discriminatory acts
Establish clear nexus to Convention ground
Provide expert country conditions evidence

IFA_AVAILABLE.description: Viable Internal Flight Alternative exists in country of origin
indicators: Non-state agent of persecution with limited geographic reach
Claimant previously lived safely in other regions
Urban center available where agents unlikely to locate claimant
No evidence state cannot protect in IFA region
mitigation_strategies: Document agent's reach across country
Show unreasonableness of IFA (hardship, discrimination)
Evidence of past attempts to relocate that failed
Personal circumstances making IFA unreasonable

STATE_PROTECTION_AVAILABLE.description: Failed to rebut presumption of state protection
indicators: No evidence of systemic state failure
mitigation_strategies: Document attempts to seek protection
Evidence of police corruption or unwillingness
Country conditions showing systemic failure
Explain why seeking protection would be futile

STCA_BAR.description: Safe Third Country Agreement bars the claim
indicators: Entry from U.S. at official land border
Entry along border within 14 days of claim
mitigation_strategies: Document applicable exception (family in Canada, minor, etc.)
Evidence of ineligibility to make claim in U.S.
If entered more than 14 days ago, document timeline

EXCLUSION_GROUND.description: Article 1F exclusion applies - person excluded from protection
indicators: Military service in conflict zone during atrocities
Senior government official in persecuting regime
Prior conviction for serious crime abroad
Evidence of complicity in crimes against humanity
mitigation_strategies: Complex legal arguments required
Challenge characterization of crimes as political
Evidence of duress or coercion
Distinguish personal involvement from organizational membership

IDENTITY_UNESTABLISHED.description: Cannot establish identity on balance of probabilities
indicators: Country of origin cannot be confirmed
mitigation_strategies: Obtain certified copies of birth certificates
Witness statements from family/community
Education records or employment documents
Explain circumstances of document loss

CESSATION_RISK.description: Grounds for cessation of protection status exist
indicators: Applied for passport from country of persecution
mitigation_strategies: Explain compelling reasons for any travel
Document ongoing risk despite changes
Show compelling reasons from previous persecution (A108(4))
Evidence travel was not voluntary re-availing

SUR_PLACE_WEAK.description: Sur place claim lacks sufficient basis
indicators: Political activity in Canada appears manufactured
No evidence country of origin aware of activities
Timing of activities coincides with refugee claim
mitigation_strategies: Document genuine belief and commitment
Evidence of country monitoring activities abroad
Show activities are continuation of prior convictions
Expert evidence on country's surveillance capabilities

DELAY_CONCERN.description: Significant delay in making refugee claim
indicators: Long period in Canada before claiming
mitigation_strategies: Document reasons for delay (trauma, lack of knowledge)
Show circumstances changed triggering claim
Evidence claim was always intended
